docs.lead_paragraph: Readers respond to an Op-Ed article by David A. Kessler, a former F.D.A. commissioner.
docs.snippet: Readers respond to an Op-Ed article by David A. Kessler, a former F.D.A. commissioner.

docs.lead_paragraph: The number of people with dementia and the cost of caring for them are skyrocketing at a rate that rarely occurs with a chronic disease, a new study suggests.

headline.seo: Dementia Care Costs Are Soaring, Study Finds
headline.main: Dementia Care Cost Is Projected to Double by 2040
headline.print_headline: Dementia Study Predicts A Surge In Cost And Cases

docs.abstract: Study published in New England Journal of Medicine finds that financial burden of caring for patients with dementia is at least as high as that of heart disease or cancers, and probably higher; finds that both costs and number of Americans with dementia will more than double within 30 years, skyrocketing at rate that rarely occurs with chronic disease.
docs.snippet: The number of people with dementia and the cost of caring for them are skyrocketing at a rate that rarely occurs with a chronic disease, a new study suggests.

docs.lead_paragraph: By tracking one patient’s immune response, scientists have discovered how a series of mutations led to an antibody that could defeat many H.I.V. strains.

headline.seo: AIDS Vaccine Path Suggested by Study
headline.main: Possible Path to Vaccine for AIDS Is Suggested
headline.print_headline: Possible Path To Vaccine For AIDS Is Suggested

docs.abstract: American scientists, in what may be important step toward long-elusive AIDS vaccine, minutely track one person's powerful immune response to the virus to see how series of mutations led to an antibody that can defeat many HIV strains; study is published in journal Nature.
docs.snippet: By tracking one patient’s immune response, scientists have discovered how a series of mutations led to an antibody that could defeat many H.I.V. strains.

docs.lead_paragraph: A debate is raging around a prize named after Dr. Thomas Parran Jr., who has been linked to unethical experiments, including the Tuskegee syphilis study.

headline.seo: Link to Ethical Scandals Tarnishes Prestigious Parran Award
headline.main: Of Medical Giants, Accolades and Feet of Clay
headline.print_headline: Of Medical Giants, Accolades and Feet of Clay

docs.abstract: Members of the American Sexually Transmitted Diseases Association are engaged in fierce debate over whether to rename award named after Dr Thomas Parran Jr, country's sixth surgeon general; Parran revolutionized medical policy concerning sexually transmitted diseases but is also linked with two of the most egregious medical scandals of the 20th century, including the infamous Tuskegee syphilis study.
docs.snippet: A debate is raging around a prize named after Dr. Thomas Parran Jr., who has been linked to unethical experiments, including the Tuskegee syphilis study.

docs.lead_paragraph: Production of cheap copycat drugs for H.I.V. and cancer used by people in developing countries in Africa and Asia was ensured on Monday in a ruling by India’s Supreme Court.

headline.seo: Top Court in India Rejects Novartis Drug Patent
headline.main: Low-Cost Drugs in Poor Nations Get a Lift in Indian Court
headline.print_headline: Low-Cost Drugs In Poor Nations Get Lift in Court

docs.abstract: Indian Supreme Court rules that Indian makers of low-cost generic drugs can continue making copycat versions for diseases like HIV and cancer; debate over global drug pricing is highly contentious issue between developed countries and developing world, and ruling challenges pharmaceutical industry at a time when it is increasingly looking to emerging markets to counter lackluster sales in United States and Europe.
docs.snippet: Production of cheap copycat drugs for H.I.V. and cancer used by people in developing countries in Africa and Asia was ensured on Monday in a ruling by India’s Supreme Court.

byline.contributor: Gardiner Harris reported from New Delhi, and Katie Thomas from New York.
byline.original: By GARDINER HARRIS and KATIE THOMAS
